results.title: The Race
results.creator_credit: Nikki Rose, First Light and Kinetoscope Productions
results.brief_description: Neil and David met at nursery school. There was something different about Neil but David liked him, even though he often got himself into a bad temper. Neil knew that because of his condition eventually they would part company but David vowed that they would always remain best friends.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nikki Rose, First Light and Kinetoscope Productions

results.title: Pitch Black Heist
results.creator_credit: John Maclean, Gerardine O'Flynn, DMC Film, Film4 and UK Film Council
results.brief_description: Liam (Liam Cunningham) and Michael (Michael Fassbender) are professional safe crackers who meet on a simple job to relieve an office safe from its contents. The catch is a light-activated alarm system.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Maclean, Gerardine O’Flynn, DMC Film, Film4 and UK Film Council

results.title: Two and Two
results.creator_credit: Babak Anvari, Anthony Bairstow, Kit Fraser and Flick Art
results.brief_description: In a school governed by a strict regime, the pupils are informed that what they had always been taught as fact is no longer true. But when the incredulous students speak out, they are forced to question how far they will go to stand up for their beliefs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Babak Anvari, Anthony Bairstow, Kit Fraser and Flick Art

results.title: A Morning Stroll
results.creator_credit: Grant Orchard, Nic Gill, Sue Goffe and Studio AKA
results.brief_description: Why DID the chicken cross the road? This short animation seeks the answer in the past (1959) the present (2009) and the dystopian future of 2059.

results.title: One Man's Walk
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Mitchell, First Light and Interplay Theatre
results.brief_description: A boy walks down a street. We do not see his face. He is the event but we don’t know why. He tells us his likes and dislikes as he passes through the streets of his town. Finally we see his face and understand.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kenneth Mitchell, First Light and Interplay Theatre

results.title: Godzilla in gaming
results.material_description: Screen recordings of Snipe and Wib, Friday Night Arcade and MoviEVo's YouTube channels
results.brief_description: In the early 1980s, Godzilla stomped his way onto screens through retro gaming. Godzilla (C64) (1983) first gave players a pixelated monster’s view, smashing through cities. Then came Fierce Dragon Godzilla: Metropolis Destruction (1985), a Japan-only release where Godzilla unleashed havoc on urban landscapes. The Movie Monster Game (1986) let players choose from multiple kaiju, including Godzilla, to demolish cityscapes. In Godzilla vs. 3 Giant Monsters (1984), Godzilla took on three classic kaiju in turn-based battles, bringing strategic clashes to the gaming world. Each game added to the legend, expanding the King of the Monsters’ digital footprint.
results.description: In the early 1980s, Godzilla stomped his way onto screens through retro gaming. Godzilla (C64) (1983) first gave players a pixelated monster’s view, smashing through cities. Then came Fierce Dragon Godzilla: Metropolis Destruction (1985), a Japan-only release where Godzilla unleashed havoc on urban landscapes. The Movie Monster Game (1986) let players choose from multiple kaiju, including Godzilla, to demolish cityscapes. In Godzilla vs. 3 Giant Monsters (1984), Godzilla took on three classic kaiju in turn-based battles, bringing strategic clashes to the gaming world. Each game added to the legend, expanding the King of the Monsters’ digital footprint.

Each game added to the legend, expanding the King of the Monsters’ digital footprint.

results.title: Remixing Godzilla
results.material_description: Screen recordings of @gentlebl0ke (Moo Deng and Pesto), @phthartic5 (Roar), @ideatimes (Crab legs), @beeragon (Barbie), @jaydent.26 (Fashion)
results.brief_description: Seventy years ago, when the original Godzilla film was released no one had any idea of the global impact this monster would have. As the number of films in the Godzilla franchise has increased over the decades so has the number of fans and their devotion to the King of the Monsters. These clips are an example of the ways Godzilla is celebrated and re-invented by the fans - from a comparison of monster roars from across the franchise, a fashion call out for the Godzilla themed shoes worn by the team which won the first Oscar for a Godzilla film, and a fan mash up of Godzilla and Barbie.
results.description: Seventy years ago, when the original Godzilla film was released no one had any idea of the global impact this monster would have. As the number of films in the Godzilla franchise has increased over the decades so has the number of fans and their devotion to the King of the Monsters. These clips are an example of the ways Godzilla is celebrated and re-invented by the fans - from a comparison of monster roars from across the franchise, a fashion call out for the Godzilla-themed shoes worn by the cast of Godzilla Minus One, and a fan mash-up of Godzilla and Barbie.

results.title: Hyper >> [games magazine] Issue 100, February 2002
results.brief_description:
Hyper was a multi-platform Australian video game magazine. It was Australia’s longest running gaming magazine, published from 1993 to 2019.

In addition to coverage of current major video game systems and game releases, Hyper also covered anime, DVD movies, arcade and classic games, and featured interviews with industry professionals and articles on game-related content such as game classifications, computer hardware and video game music. Hyper also had a sister magazine, the PC gaming oriented PC PowerPlay. (citation from Wikipedia).

A digital version of the magazine can be found here: https://archive.org/details/hyper-100
results.description:

Hyper also had a sister magazine, the PC gaming oriented PC PowerPlay. (citation from Wikipedia).
